education_text.0: Goldberg did his undergraduate studies at the      Massachusetts Institute of Technology Massachusetts Institute of Technology, graduating in 1982After completing his PhD, Goldberg was on the faculty of      Stanford University Stanford University and worked for NEC Research Institute, Intertrust STAR Laboratories, and Microsoft Research Silicon Valley LabAfter completing his PhD, Goldberg was on the faculty of      Stanford University Stanford University and worked for NEC Research Institute, Intertrust STAR Laboratories, and Microsoft Research Silicon Valley LabGoldberg is best known for his research in the design and analysis of algorithms for graphs and networks, and particularly for his work on the      Maximum flow problem maximum flow problemsup
